definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: The quite demeanor of the Capricorn is easily misinterpreted as cold and hard hearted.
sentences.chinese: 摩羯的这种表现很容易让人误解为冷漠和硬心肠。

sentences.english: It's common to mistake simplicity for lack of power.
sentences.chinese: 人们常常将简洁性误解为缺乏功能。

sentences.english: I write because I want to clear some misconceptions about Yoon Eun Hye.
sentences.chinese: 我写这席话，是因为我想澄清一些关于尹恩惠的误解。

sentences.english: Ming zi is static grace but misunderstanding that the daughter.
sentences.chinese: 明子却误解那是静恩的女儿。

sentences.english: And if Baudrillard can't be understood, then he can't be misunderstood, either.
sentences.chinese: 如果鲍德里亚不能被理解，那他就不会被误解。

sentences.english: The risk is that higher headline inflation is misinterpreted as a sign that policy is too loose.
sentences.chinese: 真正的风险是高整体通胀被误解读成政策宽松的标志。

sentences.english: It is easy to misconstrue confidence as arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 很容易将信心误解为傲慢。

sentences.english: There are apparently some misconceptions about this whole monogamy thing.
sentences.chinese: 很多人显然对一夫一妻制存在着误解。

sentences.english: Do not misconstrue it as an effort to exert force or pressure.
sentences.chinese: 不要把它误解为需要卯尽全力或施加压力的苦差事。

sentences.english: This is a misunderstanding of maturity. You will never outgrow temptation.
sentences.chinese: 这是对成熟的误解，因你永远不能免于试探。

sentences.english: This can lead to misinterpretation and misrepresentation of the data contained in the enterprise data source.
sentences.chinese: 这会导致对企业数据源中包含的数据的误解和误传。

sentences.english: Rather, the author should strive to be clear, to avoid misunderstanding and confusion.
sentences.chinese: 论文必须致力于保持文意清晰，避免造成误解或混淆。

sentences.english: Finally, I’d say Huntington misunderstood the nature of historical change.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我还有说亨廷顿误解了历史变革的性质。

sentences.english: We have acted to lessen misperceptions and miscommunication between our countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们已为减少两国间的误解和误会采取了行动。

sentences.english: The car horn is like a lovely word defiled. It was never meant to be profane.
sentences.chinese: 汽车的喇叭声是个被误解的可爱字眼。

definition: to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to obscure/to confuse/to mix up/to blur/to mislead
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
